data.author: Morgan Quigley
data.message:
change URL to global tile server. (#430)

For WGS 84 (latitude / longitude) map files, the GUI will now retrieve tiles from our new tile server, which is holding OpenStreetMap's full planet data. This will allow detailed OpenStreetMap background tiles from any region of the world to show up in the Traffic Editor GUI when used in WGS 84 (georeferenced) mode.

Signed-off-by: Morgan Quigley <morgan@osrfoundation.org>

data.author: Morgan Quigley
data.message:
Feature/render OpenStreetMap tiles (#418)

* "new building" dialog box which asks which coordinates to use
* Move to C++17 for std::optional
* wgs84 workflow
* move the C++ style check into the 'main' CI test workflow
* simplify pycodestyle workflow now that it doesn't do C++
* move all CI to galactic on ubuntu 20.04
* use a subdirectory in `~/.cache` as the OSM tile cache
* show the tile cache size on the status bar
* use EPSG 3857 (meters) for rendering tile maps
* WGS84 coordinate translation
* render OSM tiles in grayscale, so the non-tile things are easier to see
* populate lat, lon property fields in EPSG3857 mode
* remove obsolete "flattened" UI stuff
* save global coords in wgs84 but render them in epsg3857 on OSM tiles
* GUI box to set the local CRS for sim/nav generation
* move all RMF keys into GeoJSON props. add start/end names
* feature_type -> rmf_type in GeoJSON properties
* translate robot spawn point along with the world
* Handle simulation offsets for models and cameras (#408)
* lat/lon translation behavior for models ( previously, builds break when adding models due to WGS84 translation not having a "rotation" variable
* change naming convention for model positions to lat/lon instead of x/y for consistency
* apply offsets to the camera as well, so the camera view appears immediately over the working area
* Handle simulation offsets for models and cameras
* revert to using xy conventions
* Pass transform in Model constructor; pass un-transformed variables for to_yaml
* Add check if global_transform was initialized; fix wrong computation of xy
* parse model coordinates in wgs84 and project for viewing/editing
* move model projection/translation to generate phase
* set user-agent string in HTTP tile requests
* workaround for 32-bit scrollbar overflow at extreme zoom
* some cleanup
* introduce a simple queuing system for tiles
* a bit of cleanup for uncrustify
* reset zoom when loading a different filename
* uncrustify / pycodestyle

Signed-off-by: Morgan Quigley <morgan@osrfoundation.org>
Signed-off-by: Charayaphan Nakorn Boon Han <charayaphan.nakorn.boon.han@gmail.com>
Co-authored-by: Morgan Quigley <morgan@osrfoundation.org>
Co-authored-by: Charayaphan Nakorn Boon Han <charayaphan.nakorn.boon.han@gmail.com>

data.author: Morgan Quigley
data.message:
First steps towards GeoJSON (#403)

* add GeoJSON support to `building_map_server`: to start, just vertices and lanes
* compress GeoJSON output on-the-fly
* add support for GeoJSON to `building_map_converter`, auto-detecting based on filename suffix
* GeoJSON: include preferred projected CRS and suggested coordinate offset for simulation as top-level keys
* sort GeoJSON keys in building map server for consistency in diffs
* fix crash for non-geolocated/legacy maps

Signed-off-by: Morgan Quigley <morgan@osrfoundation.org>

data.author: Morgan Quigley
data.message:
Improve behavior for Cartesian maps (#401)

* Improve behavior for Cartesian maps

* because Cartesian maps have 1-meter units, we need to compute
a better default scale for them. Previously it was always using
a default scale of 0.05.

* somewhat related, also fix the edge-select implementation so it
spins through all edges in the map rather than just selecting
the first edge within 10 units... that was OK when we were always
using pixel-based maps, but now that meter-based maps are in use,
it was just choosing the first edge that was within 10 meters of
the click, which was a lot of edges and felt somewhat random.

* stop drawing a 1-unit border around the scene rectangle

* rotate vertex icons to +Y for cartesian maps

Signed-off-by: Morgan Quigley <morgan@osrfoundation.org>

data.author: Morgan Quigley
data.message:
Cartesian worlds (y=up) and steps towards using GeoPackage (#396)

* create passthrough transform for cartesian_meters coordinate systems
* y-flip in traffic-editor GUI for cartesian worlds; only invert Y coordinate for legacy image-based maps
* add coordinate system files for C++ GUI
* pass coordinate system to vertex draw, to flip text as needed
* correct deprecated setuptools key to fix warning
* Fix errors when building maps with lifts / crowdsim
* draw fewer arrowheads for increased speed on very large maps
* add speed limit parameter to lane property-editor GUI
* add speed limit param to generated nav-graph files
* add site_map publishing to building_map_server for cartesian maps
* publish lane speed limits
* Change loader to CLoader for performance improvement on large maps
* on-the-fly geopackage generation for cartesian maps
* add fiona Python package dependency to package.xml and CI workflow
* building_map_converter to generate a GeoPackage from a cartesian YAML map
* add top-level metadata for building/site params
* load/save top level building params. Zoom->reset to center map view if you get lost.
* fix geopackage metadata extraction for geopackage SiteMap server
* use json instead of yaml for geopackage parameters
* assign a nonsense CRS if one doesn't exist
* Change Legacy -> ReferenceImage throughout code

Signed-off-by: Morgan Quigley <morgan@osrfoundation.org>
Signed-off-by: Luca Della Vedova <luca@openrobotics.org>

Co-authored-by: Luca Della Vedova <luca@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Morgan Quigley
data.message:
Minor tweak to how empty crowd_sim and lift structures are serialized in YAML (#364)

By default, it appears that yaml-cpp is always placing empty
sequences on their own lines if the parent map is in block style.
This is different from what the YAML library we're using in
JavaScript is doing, which causes diffs when files are saved
due to just this (meaningless) carriage reutrn. This commit
tells yaml-cpp to use flow style when the sequences are empty
in a few places in the crowd_sim data structure that are,
by default, empty sequences.

This same approach also uses YAML flow style for empty lift maps.

Signed-off-by: Morgan Quigley <morgan@osrfoundation.org>

data.author: Rushyendra Maganty
data.message:
Control slotcar with model velocity cmds in place of joint velocity cmds (#236)

* Control slotcar with model velocity cmds in place of joint velocity cmds

Sends `LinearVelocityCmds` and `AngularVelocityCmds` to mimic the
earlier motion that was achieved using `JointVelocityCmds`. Ensures
compatibility with the Trivial Physics Engine (TPE) plugin.

* Modify slotcar plugin to move any payloads along with it

* Replace brute force checking for entities with Ignition Msgs

Requires TeleportIngestor and Dispenser to send Ignition msgs when an item has
been dispensed or ingested. Messages are read by the slotcar, and
corresponding entities are added to list of payloads of the slotcar.

* Enable slotcar movement on lifts with only velocity cmds set

Modify lift plugins to monitor any payload that enters it. Adjusts
the payload's z velocity to match the z velocity of the lift, if the
payload has a pre-existing LinearVelocityCmd component (i.e. relies on
manually set velocity cmds to move)

* Miscellaneous code style changes

Adjusts formatting to pass linter checks. Adds additional comments in
slotcar and lift plugins.

* Change TeleportIngestor Ignition msg type from UInt64 to Entity

Improves maintainability if Entity type ever changes.

* Pause payload search in lift plugin when lift is not moving

* Simplify setting of linear and angular velocity cmds in Slotcar Ignition plugin

Store reference to component instead of setting each value individually

* Optimize lift plugin payload search and other minor improvements

Search for payloads only when lift state changes between MOTION_STOPPED,
MOTION_UP and MOTION_DOWN. Rename lift_en to lift_entity, and remove
check for Static component when finding payloads.

data.author: Morgan Quigley
data.message:
only build plugin support if ignition-plugin is present (#245)

Adds some CMake logic and some #ifdef throughout the code so that it doesn't compile support for "traffic-editor simulation" plugins if libignition-plugin is not present. This will remove the previous hard dependency on ignition-plugin and make it a soft dependency, and since nobody is currently using that plugin interface, that seems like a good tradeoff. Hopefully now it will become possible to release this package as a binary, using the normal ROS package release flow.

Signed-off-by: Morgan Quigley <morgan@osrfoundation.org>

data.author: Rushyendra Maganty
data.message:
Implement battery drain and recharge for slotcars (#242)

* Calculate slotcar battery state of charge

Keeps track of slotcar velocity and acceleration in order to calculate
and update the slotcar's state of charge. Broadcasts this value as part of
the robot_state_msg.

* Add toggle_charging GUI plugin and charge_msgs message type

Enables toggling of charging and battery drain using the GUI on Gazebo.
Propagates these changes to other ROS2 nodes using a charge_msgs message
type.

* Implement charger waypoints in SDF and automatic recharging near waypoint vicinity

Detects vertices that are chargers in YAML files and automatically adds
a `Charger_Waypoints` element to the world SDF file. Slotcar plugin
reads the waypoints values and automatically charges or discharges where
appropriate. Also enables instantaneous recharge.

* Add Ignition GUI plugin to toggle charging

Creates plugin using ign-gui allowing users to enable or disable charge,
battery drain and instant recharge. Also modifies sdf spec version to
1.7 and adds namespacing to charger_waypoint custom element.

* Miscellaneous minor improvements and fixes for slotcar charging

- Simplifies Gazebo GUI plugin by refactoring the create_button function
- Changes Gazebo GUI plugin hbox to vbox layout
- Renames Ignition GUI plugin .qrc File
- Enables charging and draining by default on startup
- Fixes state of charge value clamp to use std::min instead of max
- Removes time field from charge_msgs
- Reads power parameter values from SDF file instead of hardcoding values
  in slotcar_common.hpp
- Moves charging updating to earlier in the update() function to ensure
  it is called in every invocation to the function

* Replace ROS charge_msgs node with Gazebo and Ignition transport msgs

Removes the charge_msgs package.Uses individual Gazebo or Ignition
transport libraries to send messages to the repsective slotcar plugins
from the GUI plugins instead.

* Miscellaneous state of charge improvements and bug fixes

- Changes max state of charge from 100.0 to 1.0
- Computes energy lost due to angular acceleration based on the change
  in yaw angle, instead of change in Z value
- Modifies robot_state mode whenever charging
- Removes unused efficiency parameter
- Adjusts Gazebo GUI charger plugin position slightly downwards

* Read ChargerWaypoint attributes directly into doubles

Replace stringstream and pass in doubles directly

* Change soc in robot_state message to percentage and tidy up dE calculation
